intro: Ranunculus recticaulis, commonly known as the straight-stemmed buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features upright, hairy stems that can grow up to 30 centimeters in height. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are palmately divided, with a distinctive hairy texture. Ranunculus recticaulis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
